revised_title: Alfred John Sutton Pippard: A Life in Civil Engineering and Research
tldr: The article is a biography of Alfred John Sutton Pippard, a prominent civil engineer and researcher. Born into a family of builders and craftsmen, Pippard showed an early interest in studies and pursued a career in civil engineering. He worked on various projects, including the design of a steel frame for a warehouse and difficult foundation constructions. Pippard made significant contributions to the field of stress analysis and aeroplane structures during World War I, working for the Admiralty and later the Air Ministry. His work improved aircraft safety and advanced structural science. Pippard was awarded the M.B.E. for his contributions and held various positions in academia and research throughout his career.
